secret_rule: Only items that are referenced or depicted in the folklore of indigenous cultures around the world can be brought to the picnic.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "dream catcher" and "kachina doll" and "totem pole" and "shaman's drum".

Okay, based on the examples provided by the game master, it seems that the secret rule is related to Native American or Indigenous cultural items.

The examples given - "dream catcher", "kachina doll", "totem pole", and "shaman's drum" - are all traditional objects or artifacts associated with various Native American tribes and cultures.

Therefore, my best guess for the secret rule in this "Guess the Rule" game is that the acceptable items to bring are those that are traditional or symbolic items from Native American/Indigenous cultures and traditions.

Does this align with the secret rule the game master had in mind? I believe this is the most accurate guess I can make based on the limited information provided.
Correct! The rule is: Only items that are referenced or depicted in the folklore of indigenous cultures around the world can be brought to the picnic.
